       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         cadmium-added novelty consumer products

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Article 27 of the environmental conservation law is amended
    2  by adding a new title 2 to read as follows:
    3                                    TITLE 2
    4                   CADMIUM-ADDED NOVELTY CONSUMER PRODUCTS
    5  SECTION 27-0201. CADMIUM-ADDED NOVELTY CONSUMER PRODUCTS.
    6  S 27-0201. CADMIUM-ADDED NOVELTY CONSUMER PRODUCTS.
    7    1. "CADMIUM-ADDED NOVELTY CONSUMER PRODUCT" MEANS A  PRODUCT  INTENDED
    8  MAINLY  FOR PERSONAL USE OR ADORNMENT THAT CONTAINS CADMIUM IN AN AMOUNT
    9  EQUAL TO OR IN EXCESS OF .0075 PER CENT BY WEIGHT.  CADMIUM-ADDED NOVEL-
   10  TY CONSUMER PRODUCTS INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO  JEWELRY,  TOYS  AND
   11  ORNAMENTS.
   12    2.  ON AND AFTER JUNE 1, 2013, NO PERSON SHALL SELL, OFFER FOR SALE OR
   13  DISTRIBUTE FREE OF CHARGE IN THE STATE ANY CADMIUM-ADDED NOVELTY CONSUM-
   14  ER PRODUCT. A MANUFACTURER THAT PRODUCES  OR  THAT  SELLS  CADMIUM-ADDED
   15  NOVELTY CONSUMER PRODUCTS SHALL NOTIFY RETAILERS THAT SELL SUCH PRODUCTS
   16  ABOUT  THE PRODUCT BAN AND INFORM SUCH RETAILERS HOW TO PROPERLY DISPOSE
   17  OF THE REMAINING INVENTORY.
   18    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2729

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to cadmium-added
novelty consumer products

PURPOSE:
This bill would prohibit the sale of jewelry, toys or
ornaments to which cadmium has been added intentionally during
formulation or manufacturing.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

* define "cadmium-added consumer novelty product" to mean a product
intended for personal use or adornment that contains cadmium in an
amount equal to or in excess of .0075 percent by weight.

* prohibit the sale, offer for sale or free distribution of
cadmium-added novelty consumer products after June 1, 2013; and,

* require a manufacturer that produces or sells cadmium-added novelty
products to notify retailers of such ban and inform them how to
properly dispose of the remaining inventory.

EXISTING LAW:
This legislation adds a new title 2 to Article 27 of the
Environmental Conservation Law.

JUSTIFICATION:
Cadmium is a metal that is inexpensive, malleable and
highly resistant to corrosion, making it desirable for use in
plastics as a stabilizer and in electroplating; however cadmium
interferes with how the body uses calcium and has been associated
with harmful health impacts including cancer and kidney disease.

An Associated Press story found high levels of cadmium in low priced
children's jewelry on sale in the United States. This legislation
would help protect the health and safety of children and consumers by
prohibiting the inclusion of cadmium in jewelry, toys and ornaments.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2010: A.9755B Reported from Codes

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
